text:
CTR PROGRESS REPORT
CTR GRANT NO. 1987 PROGRESS REPORT NO. __

PERIOD COVERED: from 06/01/89 to 05/31/92.
Name of Investigator: Stephen B. Baylin, M.D.

Title of Original Grant: Regulation of the DNA Methylase Gene In Normal vs. Cancer Cells
i int!

   

‘The overall purpose ofthe present grant has been to characterize the human DNA-methyttransferase
{ONA-MT) gene and leam more about its potential role in the evolution of human cancers. To this end the
Specific Aims were:

Aim #1: To isolate and characterize genomic and cDNA clones for the human methylase gene.
Alen #2: To characterize the structure (Including chromosomal location) of the human DNA
‘methylase gene in normal and neoplastic cals.
Aim #3: To compare patterns of expression of the human DNA methylase gene in normal and
neoplastic calls
. PUBLICATIONS - 1969-1902

1. Siverman, AL, Park, J-G., Hamilton, S.R., Gazdar, AF., Luk, G.D., and Baylin, $B. Abnormat
‘methylation of the calcitonin gene in human colonic neoplasms. Cancer Res. 49:3468-3473, 1989.

2, ELDeiry, W.S., Netkin, B.O., Celano, P., Yen, R-W.C., Falco, .P., Hamiton, $.R., and Baylin, S.B.
High expression of the DNA methyttransferase gene characterizes human neoplastic cells and
progression stages of colon cancer. Proc. Natl. Acad. Scl. USA 88:3470.3474, 1991.

3. Nalkin, 6.0., Przepiorta, D., Burke, P.J., Thomas, E.0., and Baylin, S.B. Abnormal methylation of
the calcitonin gone marks progression of chronic myelogenous leukemia. Blood 77:2431-2434,
1991.

4, Baylin, $.B., Makos, M., Wu, J., Yen, R-W.C., de Bustros, A., Vertino, P., and Nelkin, 8.0. Abnormal
ppatterns of DNA methylation in human neoplasia: Potential consequences for tumor progression.
Cancer Calis 3:383-390, 1991.

5. Maks, M., Neikin, B.O., Lerman, ML, Lati, F., Zbar, B., and Baylin, $.8. Distinct hypermethylation
ppatterns occur at altered chromosome loc! in human tung and colon cancer. Proc. Natl. Acad. Scl.
USA g9:1929-1933, 1992

 

6 Yen, R-W.C., Vertino, P.M., Nelkin, B.D., Yu, J, El-Delry, W., Cumaraswamy, A,, Lennon, G.G.,
Trask, B.., Colano, P., and Baylin, $.B. Isolation and characterization of the CDNA encoding
human DNA methyitransferase. Nucleic Acids Res., In press, 1992.

7. Wud, Issa, J.P., Herman, J, Nelkin, B.D., and Baylin, $.B. Expression of an exogenous eukaryotic
DNA methytransferase gone induces transformation of NIH 3T3 cells. Submitted, 1992.

8. Issa, J.-P., Vertino, P., Celano, P., Nelkin, B., Hamilton, S. and Baylin, S. ONA methyttransferase_
activity Is increased In human colon cancer and in the mucosa of pationts at risk for cancer, In
reparation, 1992.

summary: The grant was awarded to Stephen B. Baylin, M.D. The aim was to characterize the human DNA-methyttransferase gene and leam more about its potential role in the evolution of human cancers. It covered the period from 06/01/89 to 05/31/92. Aims were to isolate and characterize genomic and cDNA clones.
